### Retirement and executive career

[edit]

He retired at the end of the contract with Cherno More in December 2024. In January 2025 he became the new sporting director of Romanian Liga II club Bihor Oradea "FC Bihor Oradea (2022)").

## International career

[edit]

On 11 October 2013, Ke»ôer√º made his full debut for Romania in a 4‚Äì0 win against Andorra, scoring the first goal of the match.

He was selected in Romania's squad for UEFA Euro 2016, playing the full 90 minutes in the second group match against Switzerland. This was Ke»ôer√º's only appearance of the tournament, as his country finished bottom of the group.

In 2019, Ke»ôer√º scored five goals in three games for Romania in matches against Sweden, the Faroe Islands and Norway counting for the UEFA Euro 2020 qualification. [...] Claudiu Andrei Ke»ôer√º (Romanian pronunciation: (/wiki/Help:IPA/Romanian "Help:IPA/Romanian"); born 2 December 1986) is a Romanian former professional footballer who played as a striker#Striker "Forward (association football)").

After starting out at his hometown side Bihor Oradea "FC Bihor Oradea (1958)"), Ke»ôer√º soon moved to Nantes in 2003. Over the course of nearly eleven years in France, he represented five clubs and amassed Ligue 1 and Ligue 2 totals of 240 appearances and 67 goals.
